security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/prompt skill with no executable code. The SKILL.md file contains only testing methodology documentation, TDD guidance, and example patterns. No scripts, network calls, file system access beyond standard AI tools, or external command execution patterns were detected.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code leads to gaps and missed edge cases. This skill provides a structured TDD workflow with RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycles, real implementation testing without mocking, and E2E validation using Playwright.
actual_capabilities: Guide RED phase: write failing test first
Guide GREEN phase: implement minimal code to pass test
Guide REFACTOR phase: improve code while maintaining test coverage
Enforce no-mocking policy for real implementation testing
Define E2E test structure using Playwright
Categorize tests by scope: Unit, Integration, E2E
limitations: Does not generate test code automatically
Does not execute or run tests

use_cases.description: Follow RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle for new feature development

use_cases.title: Create E2E Test Suites
use_cases.description: Build comprehensive end-to-end tests with Playwright for critical user flows

use_cases.title: Establish Testing Standards
use_cases.description: Define no-mocking policy and test categorization across teams

prompt_templates.title: Basic TDD Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through the RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle for implementing a function that [describe function purpose]. Start with writing a failing test.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Test Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create integration tests for [module names]. Use actual database and real HTTP layers with MSW instead of mocks.

prompt_templates.title: E2E Test Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create Playwright E2E tests for the user flow: [describe user journey from start to completion]. Include assertions for key outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: Test Strategy Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current test setup for [feature/module]. Check if tests follow the no-mocking policy and identify gaps in coverage.

output_examples.input: Help me test a user login function using TDD
output: - Write failing test for login with invalid credentials first
- Implement minimal login code to pass the test
- Add E2E test for complete login flow

best_practices: Always write a failing test before writing any production code
Use real implementations and test databases instead of mocks
Keep tests focused on behavior, not implementation details
Verify all tests pass after each REFACTOR step
anti_patterns: Writing tests after production code (violates TDD principle)
Using mocks for external services (use MSW or test instances instead)
Skipping the RED phase by writing passing tests first
Writing tests that are too tightly coupled to implementation

faq.question: What AI tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides testing methodology guidance that applies to any AI assistant.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and methodology. It does not generate test code, run tests, or set up testing infrastructure automatically.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing test setup?
faq.answer: Use the skill prompts when starting new features or reviewing existing tests. The skill helps you follow TDD principles regardless of your testing framework.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. It does not access, store, or transmit any test data or code. All testing happens in your local environment.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing?
faq.answer: Common issues: tests may be too implementation-focused, may need better assertions, or may require test setup. Ask the skill for specific troubleshooting help.

faq.question: How does this compare to other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on TDD methodology with no mocking. Other skills may provide specific framework syntax or automated test generation.
